r.d:
The uopz extension is focused on providing utilities to aid with unit testing PHP code.
It supports the following activities:
* Intercepting function execution * Intercepting object creation * Hooking into function execution * Manipulation of function statics * Manipulation of function flags * Redefinition of constants * Deletion of constants * Runtime creation of functions and methods
r.n: - add uopz.disable ini switch (default 0) - fix gh#43: setting hook on __invoke method doesn't work on call_user_func - fix gh#48: segmentation fault (uopz_set_return) - add 4 new functions: - uopz_call_user_func(callable function, ... args) - uopz_get_exit_status() - uopz_allow_exit(bool allow) - uopz_call_user_func_array(callable function, array args) - fix PHP 7.1 compatibility - fix PHP 7.2 compatibility
